Text: [The initial scene. We hear a voice on the black screen.]

Speaker: Voice
Text: Aragami...

Speaker: Aragami
Text: ...What is this? Where am I?

Speaker: Voice
Text: Aragami...

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Who’s there?

Speaker: Voice
Text: Come to me... Follow my voice...

[We see a vague flashback in which a few ninjas hold a force field around something and one of these ninjas is the protagonist. Flashback interrupts and our protagonist becoming a ghost-ninja aragami. He looks around and tests his new body.]

Speaker: Voice
Text: Come here...
[Aragami approaches the small altar next to which materializes a girl with white hair. We see her name - Yamiko.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: It worked! The ritual worked! A real aragami... I really did it!

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: My name is Yamiko. I’m the one who invoked you. What is our name? How do you feel?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I guess an aragami really is a blank slate...

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Ara... gami?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Sorry, am I going too fast? You are an aragami, a vengeful spirit summoned through an ancient ritual. I wasn’t sure it would work...

Speaker: Aragami
Text: ...Vengeful?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Yes. A clan called Kaiho, they... they killed my people. They took our land. They have destroyed everything. We lost the war and they razed it all.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Kaiho...

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I’m one of the few who survived their attacks. They imprisoned me far away in the city’s temple. What you’re looking at now is just a projection. I don’t know how long they’ll keep me for, or if they’ll let me live... You are my only hope, Aragami.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Right... What am I supposed to do?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: For starters, you won’t get far without a weapon. Follow me.
[Aragami uses his powers to pass through the closed door.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: You can use Shadow essence? I didn’t know aragami could do that! If that’s the case then be careful in the light. It will drain your energy. Try to keep to the shadows. You can recover Shadow essence that way.
[Aragami approaches the river.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Do you think your powers could help us here?
[He teleports to the other side.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Nice! Um... What about this?
[He climbs onto the wall.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Perfect! Come. There’s something here for you.
[Aragami jumps into a small room, where he finds a small altar with a lot of snake heads and a sword on the pedestal. He takes the sword, does some training movements and puts it in its scabbard.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Yes, good. This will help.
[Aragami goes on until he runs into one of the soldiers. We see the name on the screen - that’s the soldier Kaiho, the Warriors of the Light.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Watch out, it’s one of them! Keep still.
[Aragami quietly kills a soldier and goes on.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Be careful. Kaiho soldiers are Light adepts. Their swords are imbued with Light essence. Don’t even think about confronting them directly.

[Aragami kills all the soldiers and leaves the level. In the next location, he finds a small altar with a nine-tailed fox. He is overwhelmed by visions once again, from which we understand that ninjas from the previous memory captivated a similar creature.]

Speaker: Aragami
Text: This again... Yamiko? I saw something. A vision.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I... I saw it too. The ritual must have created some kind of connection between us.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: And I had another when I woke up. Just before I met you. What does it mean?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Who knows. There aren’t many writings about the ritual I used to invoke you. Hopefully we’ll find out soon.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Let’s get moving. Can’t have you evaporating at dawn.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Okay — wait, what?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Oh! Didn’t I tell you? Your body is made of shadows. If a ray of sunlight touches it...

Speaker: Aragami
Text: At this point I’m just glad you told me at all.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Hehe... I’m sorry... Look, Aragami! There’s a scroll the statue. Let’s take a look.
[Aragami takes the scroll, receives 1 skill point and now can upgrade any skill in his arsenal.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: You absorbed its aura? Amazing... Whatever it seems to have made you stronger. Let’s keep an eye out for more.
[Aragami passes through the locked door.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: If you are out of Shadow essence just stay in the shadows for a few seconds.
[Aragami passes through another locked door.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Try to create shadows and then leap to them — you can probably climb anything doing that!

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Text: [Aragami jumps off the ledge and sees a temple nearby.]

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: See that temple? That’s where we’re headed.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Why?

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I heard they’re keeping an animal there that may be able to help us.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Aragami
Text: An animal?

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Yes. Apparently it has something to do with magic they used to entrap me. You have to find it, Aragami. By the way, is it okay if I call you Aragami?

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Aragami
Text: ...I suppose.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Text: [He goes further, kill the guards and arrives at the entrance to the temple.]

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Up here, Aragami.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Text: [Entering the temple Aragami hears the conversation of the guards.]

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Guard a talisman, guard a bird, guard this door, guard that door... Guard, guard, guard. When will we see some action?

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Those are Captain Hikaru’s orders. I don’t like it any more than you do.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: I don’t get why he’s worrying so much about a caged bird, that’s all. Tempted to go have a look.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Just... don’t. The captain will come the second you leave your post. You know it. You don’t want to see him angry.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Have you ever see him angry?

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: I was there when that snake Hyo gathered his men and ambushed Captain Yuki right when he was most vulnerable. When Captain Hikaru saw Captain Yuki dead... You’d understand if you saw that.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: But more importantly, it was me who trapped that damn bird. Don’t touch it! Okay, okay, I’ll drop it, I’ll drop it.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Text: [Aragami finds a room with a bird cage.]

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Finally! Let’s free it and move on!

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Text: [When he touches the cage, he is visited again by the vision of a past life - a bird floating in the sky -- He opens the cage and releases the bird sitting there. It flies out and Aragami follows it.]

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Huh! Good timing. I’ll try to stop it.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Text: [Aragami follows the bird until he finds several watchtowers. Having climbed one of them, the hero falls under the floor, and he has another vision. We see the world with his eyes in the first person. There is a war raging around. The hero runs into an attack with an armed sword of the enemy. Suddenly this vision is replaced by another one where we see the same village in peacetime. Returning to the present, Aragami question the spirit of Yamiko.]

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Aragami
Text: These visions... What do they mean?

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I don’t know.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Aragami
Text: It felt like I was there... I think I was using... Is it Light essence?

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: If you already use Shadow essence, you can’t be a Light adept too. And you were born this evening, remember?

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Aragami
Text: But if I’m not seeing memories... Then what am I seeing? Whose visions are these?

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I’m sorry. I don’t know... Maybe we can figure it out on the way to the city.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Right. And how can the raven help us?

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: He has been keeping an eye on Kaiho’s activities. He should be able to lead us to the talismans.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Talismans?

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: The magic seal that the Kaiho used to imprison me takes its power from six talismans. We need them all to break it.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Aragami
Text: So we have to get all of them before rescuing you?

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Yes. And thanks to this raven, it won’t take all night to find them. Hopefully.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Yamiko. Why did they keep this raven locked up?

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Maybe they didn’t want it falling into the wrong hands... like ours.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Why didn’t they just...

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Kill it? Who knows. But it’s a relief they didn’t.

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Indeed…

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Text: [He goes on killing Kaiho soldiers until he stumbles into a small passage in the rocks.]

Chapter: Chapter II: THE CALL OF THE SHADOWS
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Look! I found a path through the mountain.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Hey, listen! Aragami! We’re reaching the cemetery’s entrance. Or the exit, as the case may be... Kurosu says the first talisman is here. There are five left after this.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Kurosu?

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: The raven. I’ve decided to call him ‘Kurosu’. Suits him, right?

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Sure.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Text: [He sneak to the second area of the cementry.]

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Aragami
Text: …It doesn't feel right...

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: What was that?

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Nothing...

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: How long has it been since we got here?

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: I don’t even want to know. Feels like decades. I bet my family don’t even remember what I look like.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: If you have people waiting back home… Why didn’t you go back after the war?

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: When the Nisshoku empire wiped the Light brotherhoods off the map, we came back stronger. But can’t you see this peace is tenuous? One slip and the conflict could begin again. We can’t let that happen.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: If only we all had your determination...

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: I wonder what all these fox statues mean.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Isn’t the fox the symbol of Kyuryu’s royal family?

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Maybe you’re right. That means this is the royal crypt... We could be standing on the graves of Nisshoku’s leaders, the ones responsible for the deaths of thousands!

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Probably. What are you thinking?

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: I’m thinking I better pick a grave to take a dump on.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Ha!

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: How dare they...

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Text: [After sneaking into the far side of the cemetery Aragami finds a small altar.]

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: So this is where they put it…

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Text: [There are bells on the altar. Aragami picks them up and sees the next vision. Little Yamiko gets these bells as a gift. After that, two people break into her house and kill her family. Yamiko manages to escape from her home.]

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Aragami
Text: This again... It felt different this time.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Definitely different… That was my childhood.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Your childhood?

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I didn’t expect this. It must be another side effect of the ritual.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Aragami
Text: So that girl... it was you?

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Yes… Those bells were my father’s. You just watched him and my mother being murdered by Light adepts.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Light adepts? From the Kaiho army?

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: No… This was before Kaiho. For eons these lands have been assaulted by Light brotherhoods. Taiharo, Saigosen, Kaiho... one after another. We always managed to hold them back… until the day Kaiho came. In the end they’re all the same. Merciless murderers. Callous killers of young and old alike.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Aragami
Text: …Yamiko?

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Ah… I’m sorry. This shrine was built to honor my mother and father, whose bodies were never found. Those men, those killers, didn’t leave a shred of them behind. Nothing but these bells.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Aragami
Text: That memory… I felt the fear… the pain… I’m sorry for your loss, Yamiko.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Thank you, Aragami… We have to press on. Try wearing the bells like a bangle. You might find them useful.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Right. But I’ll give them back when I find you.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Thank you!

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Text: [Aragami fastens the bells to his armband.]

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Careful, someone’s coming! This might be a good opportunity. Use the bells to draw that guard’s attention. Perhaps we can slip past.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Text: [Aragami uses the bells.]

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: What was that?

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Text: [While the guard responds to the sound, Aragami slips past him.]

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: We got the talisman! Let’s go back and find the trail to the forest.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Text: [Aragami gets out of the cemetery, killing the soldiers guarding it.]

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I’ve always liked foxes. My mother used to sing a song about them when I was a child.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Kurosu says they keep the next talisman in a cave deep in the forest... Be careful. I’ve heard many ghost stories about these woods.

Chapter: Chapter III: CHIMES OF THE PAST
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Wonderful…

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: They blocked the path… That barrier must be linked to an orb of Light essence. I’m sure we’ll be able to get through if you destroy it.
[Aragami enters a small settlement.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: This place is familiar…

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Have you ever seen that thing… uh… the talisman?

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: No. Don’t much care to.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: How come?

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: I heard the general and captains used some rare magic to create them. The same magic that’s affecting their health, even now... Gives me chills just thinking about it.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Aren’t you even a little curious, though?

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: You heard what happened to Captain Yuki, right? He was killed because the magic made him vulnerable. Nobody wants to be near those things.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Wow… I still wonder what it looks like, though.

[Having searched Aragami settlement he finds a small cave, in which, apparently, someone was hiding - there are logs, candles and straw mats around. There, he finds a doll. When he picks up the doll, he sees a flash of past event as little Yamiko was hiding in a cave. It's raining heavily outside.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: That… That’s my precious doll. The only memento I have of my mother. She made it for me. It’s an effigy of an ancient heroine from her clan, the Shirokitsu. It inspired me to keep going, no matter what. Even through all the years I spent in this place.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: You... lived here?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Unfortunately. After the attack I was too afraid to go back to town. They might have been waiting for me. I had nowhere else to go... I thought I’d never trust anyone ever again. …Handle the doll with care, will you?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: I will. Yamiko...

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Yes?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: These talismans… Why are they being guarded so carefully? You said Kaiho used them to imprison you – I’ve seen tens of guards so far and we have just two talismans. Why are they throwing men at this?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: You see… I was very close to the Empress. I was with her when the Kaiho attacked. She’s strong – many considered her a goddess because of her immense power.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: A goddess…

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Yes. Remember when I said there are others imprisoned here with me? The Empress herself is one of them. Kaiho underestimated her when they attacked. Their leaders had to use this filthy talisman magic to seal the temple… And now they’re guarding the whole place, afraid someone might release her. Even though they couldn’t destroy the Empress back then, they’ve been looking for ways to do so ever since they captured her. This is just one of the reasons we need to hurry.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: You’re right. We’ve wasted enough time already.
[He's taking the doll with him.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: There’s a secret passage back here... I always made sure to have an escape route. Over here, follow me. I remember this place being far bigger…
[The cave is starting to fall apart. Aragami manages to get out thanks to his teleportation abilities.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Well... that was close. I suppose you weigh more than I did when I was a kid...

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Do you know how these orbs work?

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: I heard something about it once… Captain Yuki was the one that created them.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Really? How do they create Light essence like that?

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Create? The orbs don’t create it. They’re made of a rare mineral that absorbs Light essence during the day. During the night that essence produces the glow you see.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: A mineral? I thought they were just... magic crystal balls or something.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: This is basic stuff, man. It’s the same mineral our weapons are made of. Even those with barely any Light experience can command it with ease.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: I see… Wait, what? My sword?

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Please swap my shift, Captain Hikaru...
[Aragami manages to get to the far side of the guardpost.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Aragami, news from Kurosu. We’re almost at Sanzen Kozui Lake where the next talisman is. They say that long ago, this lands’ farmers came here to pray to the gods for rain… Kaiho certainly love desecrating sacred places.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Where was Kurosu? I didn’t see him.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: In this form I have a telepathic bond with him. Don’t you wonder how my apparition speaks to you without any lungs?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: …Point taken.
[Aragami kills the soldiers at a guard post and climbs into the big castle.]

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: …That’s when this land’s people left and travelled to Kyuryu. Before that, they worshipped a god of Water. I think its name was…

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Who cares? The only god I’m interested in is the Shadow Empress... They say she’s beautiful.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Are you insane? Don’t you know why we’re doing all this? She’s a monster. She killed thousands. Even our leaders couldn’t defeat her. They only just managed to trap her.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: What does that have to do with beauty? Maybe if I ask Captain Hikaru I can get my post swapped and go see the temple. Maybe I’ll see her there…

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: There’s something wrong with you.
[Aragami finds a glass sphere maintaining a protective field that stands in the way of our hero.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: They placed it on the lake’s torii… A good spot, I’ll give them that. We’ll need to take a little detour. Let’s go.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Wait a second, Yamiko.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Hm?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: I’ve been thinking… What will happen after I rescue you?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: When you free me, the Empress will be free too. She’ll destroy their general in no time, you can count on that. These barbarians aren’t very smart. They need someone to tell them what to do all the time. Without the Kaiho general, the tides will turn for our people at last.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: No, I meant… what will happen to me?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Oh…

Speaker: Aragami
Text: You summoned me to rescue you and your people, but what happens once I finish the task? Will I just… vanish?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: To be honest… I never thought about it. The ancient texts I have read didn’t mention your fate, except that the touch of sunlight releases an aragami from the corporeal realm. Don’t worry, the legends didn’t say anything bad will happen. I’ll figure something out. I did invoke you after all, right?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Right. Sorry.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: It will be okay, I promise. I need you focused, Aragami. The fate of my people depends on it.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: I am.
[He destroys the sphere and goes out to the lake. The whole lake is built up with wooden pathways, on which many guards walk. There are also many defensive spheres around that prevent advancement.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: You’ve done it! Great job, Aragami! Three more to go.
[Aragami destroys the last talisman.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: The only way out is the way we came in. Just keep going straight ahead.
[As he makes his way out, he hears two guards talking...]

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: You know this is the farthest they could possibly station us from the city?

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: I know. It’s great, right?

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Great? I’ve never been this bored in my life. I joined Kaiho for action. To fight evil. Make some heads literally roll. What’s the point of walking in circles all day and all night?

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Chopping off heads isn’t Kaiho’s main objective, you know? Whatever you say, this is the best place to guard. No one will come here. Ever.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Ugh.
[Near the exit, Aragami takes out a piece of wood wrapped in ribbon he picked up earlier. He sees a short vision like little Yamiko hiding in the grass, killing someone or something.]

Speaker: Aragami
Text: What did I just see?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: How embarrassing...

Speaker: Aragami
Text: That was you hunting, right?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I was in this forest for years. I didn’t think I could return to society. I lived hand to mouth, hunting and rooting about for shelter… Nature is cruel, you know? Those years changed me for good.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: You’re tougher than you look.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: What did you expect? A helpless princess in a castle? Well… I guess I am pretty helpless now... but just wait till you see me out of this damned prison!

Speaker: Aragami
Text: If you say so. By the way, isn’t it strange that all the talismans are… well, yours?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: It is. And I can assure you that I don’t like it one bit. Especially those Kaiho brutes touching my things…

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I’ll try not to think about it. According to Kurosu there’s only one more talisman to gather before we need to make for the city. I wonder where they put it…
[They're going out to a huge castle. From the height of the embankment on which they stand, it seems even bigger.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Huh. I can’t think of any hiding places here. Where did they put that talisman?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: What’s that place?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: What the… I don’t know what it is, but my people didn’t build it, that’s for sure.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Then who did? The Kaiho?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Most likely. Building an ugly thing like that in front of my city… What were they thinking?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: But it’s huge… If this wasn’t here before the war, how long have you been in captivity for?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I wish I could say… The dirty magic they used has kept us all asleep for… a long time, I suppose.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Well… Hopefully we’ll find out sooner rather than later.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Text: [Aragami sneaks inside the castle, jumping on one of the walls.]

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Kurosu says there’s a hidden entrance around here. I don’t like this place… Let’s make this quick, okay?

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: As always.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: So. You helped build it? The mausoleum?

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Yep. A whole bunch of us worked on it a couple of years back. Wanted to pay our respects to the guys we lost in the war. We barely laid a brick compared to those Earth adepts, though. Those guys knew how to build. I remember looking at the Kaiho army back then. It was an impressive sight. All the adepts of different elements, different guilds all coming together. We were there when history was made, my friend. Let’s drink to that later.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Text: [Once inside Aragami, he discovers that the castle is huge not only on the surface, but also underground.]

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Aragami. Kurosu has just given me some news. He says the central room is just beyond those doors. In the middle there’s a door we have to get past, but it’s protected by a Light barrier. It takes its energy from four orbs. Each one is in a separate room honoring a different element: Fire, Water, Earth, and Wind. You have to destroy them all to reach the talisman.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: How refreshing…

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Have you ever seen the Pillar of Light?

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Of course. Every year I save up some leave and go see it with family. Not something you forget in a hurry. Like those that fell in the war... How does it work, anyway? That huge ray of Light… A mechanism in the central tower, I think. Apparently it takes weeks to charge it.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Wow… Must be dangerous in there while it’s active…

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Indeed. That’s why the general decided to put… “it” inside there.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Right.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: One down, three to go. Great. Halfway there. One left… Done! Now, to the door in the central room! At last! Grab it and let’s get out of here.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Text: [Aragami picks up a medallion and sees a new vision. Little Yamiko with a piece of wood in her hands meets a young warrior with dark hair and a beard. He holds this very medallion and the doll in his hands.]

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: This… This is when I met Hyo for the first time. I lost my doll in the forest, and he found it. I tried to confront him, but he… He was one of Dakudaga’s leaders. Just like my father. My life changed again that day. I joined Dakudaga and Hyo became like a second father to me.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Hyo…

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: What was that?

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Nevermind. He… He looked strong.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Oh, he was. Hyo faced the Kaiho invasion on the front lines. I heard he survived the war, but that he later faced two Kaiho captains at once… I don’t know if he made it.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Yamiko…

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Do you feel that?

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Text: [In the center of the room rises a pole emitting rays of light, destructive to the creature of shadows.]

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: It’s a trap! Up, Aragami! Keep climbing! There! Through that door! That was close!

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Text: [Aragami successfully avoided the trap. The pillar of light breaks out of the dome of the building.]

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: That light… We have to go. Everyone must have seen that!

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Text: [Aragami sees a huge stone block with text written on it. It seems to be a description of some historical event.]

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Aragami, what are you...

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: This is…

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Text: [He sees a vision again in which Hyo, along with an army of soldiers, attacks a creature with a pointy haircut. Our hero seems to be fighting alongside him. He epically charges his sword with his hand.]

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Argh… My head…

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: What is it?

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: The war, Nisshoku and Kaiho, the way it all ended…

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Aragami… What are you talking about?

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: There must be a reason for all this. The visions are revealing something important about the war. But I can’t understand what...

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: The war?

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Yes, the… the war, that’s what I said, right? Those memories were about the war. About these lands! They must be from someone else’s past. Just like I see your memories, but these belong to… Who could…

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I can make a guess.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: You can?

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Kaiho’s general. The leader of the Kaiho army.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Kaiho’s general...

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I saw Hyo in that vision. He was on the front line. Just like I told you. It makes sense... You’re an aragami, after all.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: Yamiko?

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: You’re a being of revenge, Aragami. The moment I performed the summoning ritual, I prayed for someone who would seek vengeance for my people. Your spirit heard my call, so you were bound to me… but you were also bound to someone else. Kaiho’s general was the man who brought desolation upon us during the war. He ruined me, ruined my people. He is the target of my revenge… Our revenge.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Aragami
Text: The target… So the memories are his? I am bound to him, too? Does this mean... my purpose isn’t to save you… but to kill him?

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: …I believe so.

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Text: [Behind the door, the soldiers are heard.]

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Speaker: Yamiko
Text: They’re here. We need to go! Now!

Chapter: Chapter VI: MAUSOLEUM OF THE FALLEN
Text: [They leave.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: …Are you all right?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: That vision… The Kaiho general’s memory… it’s still echoing in my head.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: We’re lucky we found that mural. It’s a shame Kaiho were on our tail. Kurosu. What is it? Aragami! Over there!
[They see a soldier with black hair and a beard. His name is Hikaru, the last captain of Kaiho. Two soldiers are approaching him.]

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Captain Hikaru, sir! The talisman in the Mausoleum of the Fallen has been taken, sir! Awaiting orders.

Speaker: Hikaru
Text: Stay.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: …Sir?

Speaker: Hikaru
Text: Stay here. That’s not the first talisman they have taken, and the only ones left are within the city walls. The intruder will be headed there.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: But…

Speaker: Hikaru
Text: I thought we took care of all the stragglers… but at least one remains. And they know what they’re doing. She is getting stronger. I can feel it. Hold your ground. Stay alert. The enemy could be here soon. They’re making for the city.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Y-Yes, sir!!

Speaker: Hikaru
Text: I’ll return to my station within the walls. There’s no time to lose. Go!

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: That was Hikaru. Kaiho’s last living captain… Not too impressive, huh?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: He’s in the general’s memories… He might have some information we can use.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: What are you thinking, Aragami?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Nothing. Let’s go.
[He goes out to the cemetery and kills the soldiers guarding it.]

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Can you believe it? This is where it all started…

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Doesn’t exactly fill you with confidence. No wonder Captain Yuki was ambushed here. It’s as foggy as etched glass.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Soldiers! Keep your eyes open! The intruder must not enter the city!

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: …Even with my eyes peeled like potatoes I can hardly see my own nose…
[Aragami finds a grave next to which the sword from the vision is stuck.]

Speaker: Aragami
Text: What’s this?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Could it be…?
[In another vision, general Hyo, smiling nastily, goes to kill civilians. Some magician and our main character form a protective field to keep him from passing.]

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Another memory from the general… Was he escaping? Seems like this was a long time ago. That man with the patch over one eye… And that sword…

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: There’s no doubt… So it’s true. Hyo is… dead. I knew it… in the bottom of my heart, I knew… but I refused to believe… Again and again, the forces of Light take away those I care about. Mother… Father… Hyo… They will pay. Who do they think they are, tearing the ground out from beneath me? In my own home!

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Yamiko…

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: S-sorry… I lost my temper…

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Hyo will be avenged. All of them will be.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: …What?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: I’m a vengeful spirit, after all.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Aragami…
[Aragami continues his journey. He goes to a camp of Kaiho.]

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Soldiers! The Mausoleum of the Fallen is not far from here. The enemy is approaching. Don’t let your guard down!

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Aragami. We’re near one of the city’s sluice gates. It’s likely we can use it to get in.
[Once he gets through the camp, he goes to a small settlement.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Kyuryu, at last! Feels like decades since I was last here.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: How far until the next talisman?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: This is the outer wall… Kurosu says the next one is near the inner walls. We’ve some way to go yet.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Have you seen Captain Hikaru lately? He’s always been intimidating, but lately… I don’t know. He’s even worse.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Yeah, I heard the rumors. Someone said that the magic Hikaru and the others used to imprison the Shadow Empress is taking its toll. Just like it did with Captain Yuki.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: It was different with Captain Yuki, though. He became weak. Captain Hikaru has just become… intense. Sinister. Not entirely himself. He used to have a sense of justice, of honor. But now… I just pity whoever crosses his path.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: We’re getting closer to the inner walls. Are you aware what is beyond them, Aragami? Hikaru. He’s waiting for us. Kurosu has seen him as well.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: He’ll pay for his part in Hyo’s death. In all of it.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Aragami… If we make it through tonight… I’ll make sure the Empress compensates you for everything you have done.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: They say that someone took all the talismans outside the walls… Who could do that so quickly?

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: It doesn’t matter how fast they are. They’ll find Captain Hikaru waiting for them through those doors. No intruder will reach the inner walls. Ever.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: …Will he be OK?

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Hikaru? He used to dispatch four Nisshoku scum with one blow. He even faced the Shadow Empress and lived to tell the tale. Worry about yourself, not him.
[They go out to the high tower. Next to the entrance, by the gravestone, there is a broken staff.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Is that a gravestone? What happened here?
[Aragami sees that this broken staff belonged to an old magician who taught him to create a barrier.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Another vision?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: “Essence flows from the soul. Soulless beings will never generate or command it.”

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Aragami… Are you all right? Did the vision do something to you?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: That was Master Tsuyoshi, the one who taught Kaiho’s leaders the technique which let them capture you and your empress. Those words are his.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: How do you…?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: I just know. Like in the Mausoleum. It must be the general’s memories. Even though Tsuyoshi was an enemy of Nisshoku, his wisdom was real. He taught Kaiho’s leaders a lot about essence, and… those words… Do you think I have a soul? Do you remember anything in your ancient scrolls about aragami’s souls?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I… don’t think so. Does it matter?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Of course it matters. Don’t you understand? My Shadow essence… It isn’t part of the ritual which summoned me. It flows from a soul. If I had no soul, I’d have no essence. But whose soul? Where did it come from? I’m not human. Souls don’t just appear out of thin air… What if I’m… somebody… reincarnated. I use Shadow essence and the sword as if they’re second nature to me. I could from the moment I woke up. Is that because I’m an aragami, or because part of my being is someone’s soul – someone who could wield the sword, could control Shadow essence, before they died? What if-

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Aragami, slow down for a second. Please. What are you saying?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: I’m sorry… Having someone else’s memories jostling in my head… I just want to know who I am. I feel like I’m missing something.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: It’s fine… I understand. You must think I’m a terrible summoner. I invoked you but I can’t even answer a simple question about aragami. You know, maybe you’re right! Perhaps aragami are reincarnations of dead warriors. Maybe you were part of Nisshoku’s forces in a past life, and that’s why you can use Shadow essence! Don’t worry. We’ll find out what your real nature is. I’m sure of it. But for now you need to keep your head. I can’t have you fall at Hikaru’s feet. The time has come. This is the only path. I don’t know what Hikaru has in store for you, but I’ll help you as much as I can… Be careful.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Don’t worry, Yamiko. I’ll deal with him.
[Aragami makes his way to where the last captain Hikaru is.]

Speaker: Hikaru
Text: He’s here… Ugh… Soldiers! The time has come! You’ve come far, but it’s over.
[The battle with the dying captain begins.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Aragami! The orb on Hikaru’s back is protecting him. You must destroy it! He’s defenseless now! Attack! Aragami! Focus on Hikaru, his shield is down! The orb is leaking light through the crack... You won’t be able to hit it from there again... You’ll need to crack it from above now! Try and attack from behind! Wait… There’s still a second barrier connected to the orbs around here. Go for those first! Well done, Aragami – now break Hikaru’s orb! Strike it again! Come on, you can do it!
[Aragami breaks the captain's defense and begins to fight him with swords, and, of course, wins.]

Speaker: Hikaru
Text: What is this…? You’re not just Nisshoku…
[Before Aragami's eyes there is a memory - Hikaru is the same boy who fled from the bloodthirsty general Hyo.]

Speaker: Hikaru
Text: It’s… It’s her… no doubt about it. The voices… the pain… my chest… Shadow Empress! What was it – “Yamiko”? Show yourself, you beast! What kind of trick is this?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: I’ve come for vengeance. To avenge the pain inflicted on this land by Kaiho. Once the morning comes, this land and these people will be free once more.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: ...Aragami. He can’t hear you...

Speaker: Hikaru
Text: Free? Hah. Do you even know what you’re setting free? You will unleash another war. Nisshoku’s darkness will spread again… Thousands of innocents will perish. All because of you!

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Just like that you have done here.

Speaker: Hikaru
Text: You… You know nothing. Nothing!

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Why should I trust you? I’ll give you one chance at redemption. If your general surrenders tonight-

Speaker: Hikaru
Text: Ha! “Redemption”. I don’t need you to trust me. Nor do I need your compassion. I won’t die by your heinous blade. I won’t let you undo all that we have paid for with our sacrifices. Sacrifices Kaiho’s people made to end the war. Sacrifices I made…

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Aragami, run!
[Hikaru explodes with a dazzling flash of light. Aragami dodges it.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Aragami! You’re just full of surprises, aren’t you? How did you survive that?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: I’m not sure. I didn’t mean to do it. It just… happened.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: …“Just happened”? Anyway – you did it! Hikaru is gone! The last Kaiho captain… You did it!

Speaker: Aragami
Text: He didn’t seem to be on form… And did he call you the Shadow Empress? Yamiko… What did he mean?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Uh… The fact is… I… was going to tell you when we finished. …I am the Shadow Empress. I know, I should have told you when I summoned you… But I was worried. I said she was here, it wasn’t a complete lie-

Speaker: Aragami
Text: It was! They call you a goddess!

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: No, I’m not a goddess, not like that. I’m just… more powerful than the average…

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Why didn’t you tell me?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: If you were considered a god, respected by all, how would you feel if you were trapped like a mouse, and the only thing you could do was summon the help of some random, fragile spirit? No offense.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: ...You felt ashamed? We don’t have time for this, Yamiko. Lies won’t help us. Understand?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Yes… yes… From now on, I promise, no more lies. I promise.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Finally! This is the military district. The path to the temple begins here. According to Kurosu they put the talisman in the castle, so that’s where we’re going!

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Did you hear something, by the way? Just a few minutes ago. Like there was an explosion out past the inner wall… I swear I saw a flash as well.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: It’s muggy today – maybe it was thunder? Could be a storm coming in…

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Thunder? That close? No way, you’d have heard it too. I hope something isn’t happening. It could be the intruders…

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: No chance. There’s no way some random intruder could waltz past the inner walls and take down Captain Hikaru.

[Aragami goes up to the attic of a tall building and finds a dagger on a stand there. He touches it and sees Hyo giving this dagger to Yamiko. There are two men sitting next to her - a guy in black leather and a guy in red armor.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Ah… That takes me back… That was when Hyo gave each of us our dark dagger: a weapon only presented to members of the guild ready to undertake the most dangerous, demanding missions. I was so proud that day…

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Those boys at your side… Who are they?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: …Orochi and Ryuta. I was partnered with them. We formed one of the best teams Dakudaga had ever had.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: I see… You really were something else, weren’t you? Which one was on the right?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Ryuta. Why do you ask?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: (That armor…]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Anyway, only one talisman left. I can almost smell freedom! Kurosu found a hidden path to the temple. It should save us some time. Dawn is near. Let’s hurry. We don’t want you turning into aragami soup.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Very funny. I expected a goddess to have some manners.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Hey!

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Look at all these statues of the Shadow Empress… I’ve never trusted sects. Any of them. Nothing but a bunch of fanatics doing what they want in the name of a god. Nisshoku was no different.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Fanatics? Didn’t your mother teach you not to label people? As if guilds don’t do what they want as well.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Don’t you tell me-

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Yes, I was in a sect before I joined Kaiho. Got a problem with that? For your information, we never met a single guild of good men.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Hey, I didn’t mean any offense-

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Then think before you open your mouth.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: I always thought he was a bit weird…

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Good, the shortcut worked. Almost there… Almost time for these Kaiho idiots to kiss this world goodbye…

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: At this rate my heart’s going to fall out of my mouth…

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: You all right?

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: We’re so close to the temple. To the Shadow Empress. I can understand why no one wants this patrol.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Any patrol is a short straw.

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: This isn’t a joke! What will we do if she breaks free? Didn’t you hear about the intruder? He’s here to get her. And we can’t stop him!

Speaker: Kaiho Soldier
Text: Don’t lose your head just yet. The general is watching over the temple, remember? Any intruder’s guts will be decorations the second he sets foot around here.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: See that tower, Aragami? Kurosu says the last talisman’s there at the very top. The last one already… Can you believe it?
[Aragami continues to methodically carve soldiers and bully them to the top of the tower. There she finds a medallion with a dragon on it.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Finally…
[After picking up the medallion Aragami see young Hikaru fighting Ryuta in a form of a dragon and defeating him. Young Yamiko sees it all. She is embraced by rage.]

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Those were your partners in Dakudaga, right? And the Light adepts… I’ve seen them before.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: The ones who killed my parents.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Were they in the war too?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: It had to be this memory… No, this wasn’t from the last war. This happened years before. Dakudaga sent me on a mission. It just turned out to be the same city these… “men”… were from… It was the perfect opportunity to finally avenge my parents… Orochi, Ryuta, and I struck, but they saw it coming.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Our vengeance will reach them too.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Oh, that won’t be necessary… They’re dead. I killed them. All of them. I reduced their whole city to rubble. When they killed Orochi and Ryuta, the anger… A great power awoke within me. I lost my senses. But it’s all right. They deserved to die. My family and friends weren’t their only victims, you know? For years upon years they killed people from all around the continent. But from that night on, I vowed to make sure the world knew of my power. An oath to protect all the land’s subjects from any Light brotherhood’s attacks. Peace would come at last. Then, out of the blue Kaiho appeared. The Light wanted to usher in another era of oppression… and they almost managed. You’re one step away from becoming the savior of these lands, Aragami.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Let’s take that step.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Kaiho’s general could appear at any moment. Be careful. I know I’ve said it a million times, but please… be careful.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Don’t worry. I’ll make it.
[We flied away some distance from the tower. Kaiho’s General, Sora, is practicing with her bow that shoots rays of light.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Aragami, look! That must be the general!

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Her? But in the visions…

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I need you focused now. She can feel your presence. If she focuses on you, hiding in the shadows won’t help much.
[Aragami finds and confronts her.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: We’re safe for now…

Speaker: Aragami
Text: She keeps leaping further away. Any ideas?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: She’s more cautious than Hikaru. And she seems to be keeping track of you more easily than he did… Just keep going. Sooner or later she’ll have to face you. She fled to the temple!

Speaker: Aragami
Text: I almost had her. Something doesn’t fit, Yamiko. I thought the general was a man…

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Do not hesitate now, Aragami. You have the talismans. You’ll be all right. Just set me free.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Right… Just hold on.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: I can feel you getting closer with each step, Yamiko. I think I sense you in the next room. What do I do with the talismans? How do I rescue you? …Yamiko?
[He walks into a big building. Yamiko's gone somewhere.]

Speaker: Aragami
Text: What is that thing? …Yamiko?
[When he enters the huge hall, he sees a huge ball of energy in its center. Next to it is Sora. Aragami runs up to her. After a short fight, he pierces her with his sword.]

Speaker: Sora
Text: …Ryo?
[Aragami picks up Sora falling to the floor.]

Speaker: Aragami
Text: What did you just say?

Speaker: Sora
Text: How can it be? I felt you… Ryo…

Speaker: Aragami
Text: That name… Who is Ryo? Tell me!

Speaker: Sora
Text: Ryo… Kaiho’s first general. He died here… five years ago.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: The first… What does that have to do with me? You are Kaiho’s general! Killing you is my duty! That’s why I’m here! Yamiko! Where are you?!

Speaker: Sora
Text: …Yamiko? Now it makes sense…

Speaker: Aragami
Text: What?

Speaker: Sora
Text: That’s why I feel him within you… You must be him… You are Ryo.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: That… That’s ridiculous!

Speaker: Sora
Text: If you’re not Ryo… Then why are you holding me? You know it. You know it as well as I do. Try to remember… We came here to defeat Nisshoku.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: No…

Speaker: Sora
Text: Yuki, Hikaru… All of us, everyone who joined to end Nisshoku’s tyranny… even old Master Tsuyoshi…

Speaker: Aragami
Text: No!

Speaker: Sora
Text: The power of the Empress was overwhelming. We had to use the forbidden technique, but it wasn’t enough. You pushed it further than anyone ever had. You sacrificed yourself to give us a chance… but we still couldn’t defeat her.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Enough!

Speaker: Sora
Text: Why resist it, Ryo?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: It can’t be true… If it is, then what have I been doing all night?

Speaker: Sora
Text: Don’t let the guilt suppress your memories… Let them flow. You have to remember…

[She touches his face and he remembers. The memories are lined up in a row. His training. The battle with Hyo and the Shadow Empress. The Empress's captivity with Hikaru and Sora. When he wakes up, Sora gives him his sword.]

Speaker: Sora
Text: Welcome back, Ryo.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Sora… What… What have I done? I’ve slaughtered us. Slaughtered us all. My own men, as if they were animals! I forced Hikaru to kill himself… And now you… Please forgive me…

Speaker: Sora
Text: Ryo… Don’t apologize. It wasn’t your fault. You know who did this. My light… I can feel it fading… Ryo… Don’t mourn… for me…

Speaker: Aragami
Text: No! I… I won’t let you die! I can’t lose you again!

Speaker: Sora
Text: It’s all right… I’m happy. Happy I saw you again… My soul… is… finally…

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Sora? Sora!
[She's dead. Aragami roars of despair. Sora's soul flies off to a giant glowing ball. The balloon explodes with dark energy. Yamiko emerges from it.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I’m free! I’m free! You did it, Aragami! Come here with me! You’re amazing! Even in the face of adversity, you did it! I’m so grateful! You’ve been a perfect aragami. Come, I’ll reward you.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: How could you?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: What?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: How could you use me like that? Those visions were fragments of my past. My mind trying to remember everything since the beginning.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: What are you saying?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Do you take me for a fool? I’ve remembered everything! You’re not getting in my head ever again.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Are you sure?
[She materializes a dozen copies of herself and they start to non-stop talking. Aragami's head starts to hurt.]

Speaker: Yamikos
Text: Aragami! Save me please! I’m trapped… We were attacked…
[Yamiko herself turns into a Shadow Empress with a haircut in the form of a ninety-tailed fox and a black dress like a tar stain.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Impressive… Took her time, didn’t she?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Don’t touch her!

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Well, well… That’s how you speak to the one who gave you life?

Speaker: Aragami
Text: I was right. I am a reincarnation. General Ryo of Kaiho, brought back to life by you to further your own twisted goals. You knew it the whole time… and you kept stringing me along!

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I didn’t plan everything. I was just as surprised as you when you started remembering things. I just summoned your soul to the cemetery and forced it into a shape. I didn’t know these memories would come with you. But the way I got you to rescue me was brilliant, right? You were so close to working it out a couple of times!

Speaker: Aragami
Text: I knew you were ruthless, but this… Were those visions of your past another ruse to earn my trust?

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: …You were never supposed to see that. That’s the second reason I’ll kill you. But now you ask, I suppose the link between our souls – the one that let you see into my past – occurred because of the fragment of my soul that you stole from me when you died. Don’t you think it’s time to return it already? That’s the first reason, by the way.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: …Fine. You’ll kill me and your soul will become whole again. You’ll regain all your power, and I, the last Kaiho officer, will be dead. But tell me, “Shadow Empress”, what will you do then? You’re alone. We destroyed Nisshoku five years ago. Only a few lowly fanatics remain in hiding. And without your counsellor, Hyo, how far do you think you’ll get? We knew all about it, by the way. That Hyo was the brains behind Nisshoku and you were just the brute force, the tool he used to spread fear. To command these lands.

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: How dare you… How dare you! I won’t kill you just yet. You saved me, after all… Let’s play a game.
[The final battle begins.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Here’s how it works: you try to catch me, over and over again, and then when I get tired I kill you.

Speaker: Aragami
Text: (I’ll have to go along with her it until she lets her guard down…]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: You really think you can defeat me? The Shadow essence you’re using comes from my soul! Mine!

Speaker: Aragami
Text: (Close… Where did you go, Shadow Empress…]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Who do you think you are! You owe me your life! I’m your goddess!

Speaker: Aragami
Text: (Almost had her… Come on…]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: Enough! I’m getting tired now. Let’s see you try this!

Speaker: Aragami
Text: (She’s getting impatient… I have to finish this quickly… I’ll have to attack from above… Maybe those lamps will help…]
[Aragami tries to attack her from above but the Empress teleports and attacks him with a ball of dark energy.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: You’ve been fooled again, Aragami…
[...but Aragami turns into a dragon and the attack does not damage him.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: That technique… that’s Ryuta’s!
[The technique took Aragami's last strength.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: I’ve had enough of this. Die!
[Suddenly Kurosu attacks the Empress and she falls to the floor.]

Speaker: Aragami
Text: Kibo!
[Aragami picks up his old sword. It begins to emit light that paralyzes his hand.]

Speaker: Aragami
Text: My arm… This body won’t withstand another trick like that. Perfect timing, Kibo. At least one of us will make it… Yamiko… I have no right to blame you for what you’ve done. The fury, the thirst for revenge in your eyes… I felt it myself when we wrought vengeance on the men who killed our families. But we had each other. We carried on as a new family, bound by revenge. But you… You were alone. You lost everything. If I had lost the others… Would I have ended up just like you? Maybe we’re not that different after all.
[He sees Yamiko's memories, only in reverse order. Ryuta's death. The blade Hyo gave her. Attack with a wood plank from the grass. Escape from home with a doll. Attack on the village.]

Speaker: Aragami
Text: We’re leaves trapped in a hurricane, Yamiko. A storm of vengeance. A cyclone of light and darkness that has been twirling since before you or I even existed. It has sucked us in, and now we’re the ones making it spin. It has to end, Yamiko. I died once for revenge… and I won’t let it happen again. I wish there was another way.
[With his sword in his hand, he goes to Yamiko, beating off her energy balls. As he approaches her, she closes her eyes, preparing to die.]

Speaker: Yamiko
Text: So do I.
[He strikes and there's an explosion. They both dissolve in the air, leaving behind only a sword and a doll.]

She didn’t like the idea to begin with, but she has learnt to trust them. I can see it building, like a chain forged with unbreakable iron. Dakudaga has never witnessed a team so young yet so powerful. I even like their motif, which is the result of putting their family symbols together: the fox from Yamiko, the snake from Orochi, and the dragon from Ryuta.

I didn’t want to leave them behind… but I didn’t tell Yamiko the city was a Saigosen stronghold. She doesn’t seem to remember their flag, so I decided not to mention it at all. This is a recon mission
Text: we can’t reveal our blade before we are ready to strike. We’re going there to find out how powerful they’ve become and prepare our attack. If Yamiko knew she was going where her parents’ killers were based… She is intelligent and trustworthy, but her anger is a force to be reckoned with.

Time/Location: We depart next week.
Speaker: We were unable to speak as we watched Yamiko walk out of the city she had just destroyed. Ruined buildings, bodies, and dust were left in her wake. A lifeless gaze had fixed in her eyes. She stopped in front of us. No one could move. I waited for her to say something. What had just happened? What had triggered this… this phenomenon? But her mouth didn’t open, not even for a moment. She just stood there. Gradually, the others started to bend their knees. In fear, no doubt. But I felt no fear. My concern for Yamiko’s safety outweighed every other feeling. Then it struck me
Text: she was alone. In a small voice I asked her, “Orochi and Ryuta?” She looked at me with glassy eyes, and slowly shook her head. I ran to embrace her.

Speaker: When the Fire adept lights a bonfire with their bare hands, or when an Earth adept cracks the ground they stand upon with the tiniest of movements, essence is being emitted from their bodies and channeled into the world through an element. As far as we know, there are seven pure elements
Text: Fire, Water, Earth, Wind, Light, Darkness , and Life. Then there are the hybrid elements, born from a mixture of pure elements, but I’ll leave those for another time.

Time/Location: September 1, Year 32 of the Fifth Age
Speaker: More than once I’ve been asked if an adept of a certain element is born or made. Well, it’s true that you can be born with an innate inclination towards one element, but this only means it will be easier for you to use it if you decide to study it. It will still not come naturally. It is like a canvas
Text: when you are born your soul is blank, and it is you who decides which color to paint it. From Fire-red, to Water-blue, to Shadow-black. The more you paint the canvas, the more powerful you become.

Time/Location: September 1, Year 32 of the Fifth Age
Speaker: There are those who think that the essence an adept picks defines who he or she is
Text: Light for the good, Darkness for the bad, Fire for the brave… Based on my vast experience I can say that essence has no bearing on personality. It’s based on pure chance. Guilds who worship a specific element aren’t necessarily better than sects who worship a god or gods. I’ve met sects that paid respect to their gods without harming anyone, and guilds that destroyed others just because they could…

Text: teaching the command of Life essence to all brotherhoods under Nisshoku attack. Just to give them a slightly better chance. But licking wounds wasn’t the solution. Sooner or later someone had to do something, and the Master knew it. When we told him that we were determined to lead a counterattack, he hardly looked surprised. After a short pause, he said, “Well. Your classes start tomorrow.”

Speaker: It gets worse every day. “Pain” doesn’t even come close
Text: it’s in my soul. I feel it every minute, every second… I hear her voice in my head telling me to give up. Imploring me. There’s no way I can sleep. Passing some of it to Kibo barely alleviated my pain, and now he has part of her within him. We have to keep him confined.
